item.title: Environment variables and keys
item.description: Environment Variables Programmers often write code that interacts directly with the cloud, which requires the use of private keys. We need our code to be shareable and useable without sharing secret passwords, usernames, or keys in the code. Environment variables are the key to keys. What is an environment variable? An environment variable is a variable that exists outside of your code but is created within your coding environment on startup.
